alert.note: Alert for DeWitt (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 8:34AM CST until January 27 at 12:23PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Guadalupe River Near Cuero affecting DeWitt County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Guadalupe River near Cuero. * WHEN...From this morning to early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Flooding extends into floodplain above Cuero threatening livestock. US Hwy 183 North at Hochheim has water on or crossing the roadway. Highway likely closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 9.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 19.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning before cresting at 26.9 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (9 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Guadalupe River Cuero 24.0 9.7 Wed 7 am CST 24.5 26.6 21.2 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 845 PM CST.
